channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Ants treat certain leg injuries with lifesaving amputations
item.description: A new study suggests ants therapeutically amputate the limbs of injured buddies to save them. (Story aired on All Things Considered on July 2, 2024.)
item.content:encoded: A new study suggests ants therapeutically amputate the limbs of injured buddies to save them. (Story aired on All Things Considered on July 2, 2024.)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: These Democrats could replace Biden. And, Labour wins U.K. election
item.description: Biden says he's staying in the 2024 race. If he changes his mind, these Democrats could be potential candidates, this year or in 2028. And, Labour gets a historic victory in the U.K. elections.
item.content:encoded:
Biden says he's staying in the 2024 race. If he changes his mind, these Democrats could be potential candidates, this year or in 2028. And, Labour gets a historic victory in the U.K. elections.

(Image credit: Ricky Vigil)
item.dc:creator: Majd Al-Waheidi

item.title: Post presidential debate: it's a remarkable moment in American politics
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Mary Kate Cary, who wrote speeches for President George H.W. Bush, and Paul Orzulak, who was a Clinton administration peechwriter, about current presidential politics.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Mary Kate Cary, who wrote speeches for President George H.W. Bush, and Paul Orzulak, who was a Clinton administration peechwriter, about current presidential politics.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: A landslide victory in Britain for a party that hasn’t been in power since Tony Blair
item.description: The next British prime minister will be Keir Starmer, from the center-left Labour Party. It was a near wipeout for the Conservatives -- the party's worst defeat in its nearly 200-year history.
item.content:encoded: The next British prime minister will be Keir Starmer, from the center-left Labour Party. It was a near wipeout for the Conservatives -- the party's worst defeat in its nearly 200-year history.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Britain swings to the center-left in historic U.K. election landslide
item.description: After 14 years of Conservative rule, Britons elected a new prime minister and parliament dominated by the Labour Party, which hadn't won a national election since Tony Blair, nearly 20 years.
item.content:encoded:
After 14 years of Conservative rule, Britons elected a new prime minister and parliament dominated by the Labour Party, which hadn't won a national election since Tony Blair, nearly 20 years.

(Image credit: Ricky Vigil)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Take a sneak peek into a legendary songwriter's creative process
item.description: The Library of Congress has acquired the papers of Leslie Bricusse, the songwriter who gave us "Pure Imagination," "What Kind of Fool Am I?," "Goldfinger" and "Talk to the Animals."
item.content:encoded: The Library of Congress has acquired the papers of Leslie Bricusse, the songwriter who gave us "Pure Imagination," "What Kind of Fool Am I?," "Goldfinger" and "Talk to the Animals."
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: With suggestive poses and pets, 'wacky' election campaigning tests Tokyo's patience
item.description: This year's wackiness — notably from non-candidates renting campaign billboard space — is proving exceptional, and residents have flooded election offices with angry calls and messages.
item.content:encoded:
This year's wackiness — notably from non-candidates renting campaign billboard space — is proving exceptional, and residents have flooded election offices with angry calls and messages.

(Image credit: Eugene Hoshiko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Alabama quilters find ways to bring financial benefits to their community
item.description: The historical quilting collective Gee's Bend has made colorful imagination for decades. Now, they are working to monetize their artistry.
item.content:encoded: The historical quilting collective Gee's Bend has made colorful imagination for decades. Now, they are working to monetize their artistry.
item.dc:creator: Kyle Gassiott

item.title: Stories of new U.S. citizens: A Canadian on what it now means to be an American
item.description: As part of a weeklong series on new American citizens, Khadija Mohamed, who is originally from the Canada, explains what it means to her to be an American.
item.content:encoded: As part of a weeklong series on new American citizens, Khadija Mohamed, who is originally from the Canada, explains what it means to her to be an American.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Greece's new 6-day workweek law takes effect, bucking a trend
item.description: An employee who must work on a sixth day would be paid 40% overtime, according to the new law.
item.content:encoded:
An employee who must work on a sixth day would be paid 40% overtime, according to the new law.

(Image credit: Denis Balibouse)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell
